qas.question: In what year did the Human Development Report introduce the IHDI?
Which measures the potential development, the HDI or the IHDI?

plausible_answers.text: Human Development Report introduced an Inequality-adjusted Human Development Index (IHDI

qas.question: Which measures the potential underdevelopment, the HDI or the IHDI?

context: The <a0_0>2010<a0_0/> <b3_0>Human Development Report introduced an <a1_0><b4_0>Inequality-adjusted Human Development Index<b4_0/><a1_0/> (IHDI<b3_0/>). While the simple HDI remains useful, it stated that "the IHDI is the actual level of human development (accounting for inequality)," and "<a2_0>the <b5_0>HDI<b5_0/><a2_0/> can be viewed as an index of 'potential' human development (or the maximum IHDI that could be achieved if there were no inequality)."
